awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I: Gentle:  A Smart, Affordable, Soft Gripper for Robotic Food Picking and Packaging
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is the improvement in throughput of fresh fruit, vegetable, baked item picking and packing, agriculture, and tasks that require physically handling or grasping a wide range of delicate objects. The electrically-actuated soft robotic gripper technology is inherently safe to work in human-occupied environments and collaborate with human workers since its soft fingers can deform and absorb impacts in case of a collision. In addition, with the data generated from the research and development, new use cases will be opened for robotic hands in the long term such as helping farmers pick fruits from trees. Working in the robotics technology area and targeting items that are difficult to pick up by traditional robotic grippers and algorithms, the research will help automate and increase the efficiency of traditionally manual processes that suffer from a lack of enough workers to ultimately support American manufacturing. This research also has longer-term benefits to expand into other sectors such as collaborative robotics, healthcare, and assistive robotics areas because of the inherent safety and adaptability of soft robotics in human interaction. 

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project focuses on technical research and development of electrically actuated soft grippers with a modular approach, sensory integration, and feedback control, as well as the study of new algorithms and user interfaces to endow these systems with intelligence for improved performance. When there is variation in object size, weight, shape, and fragility, robotic system integrators find it difficult to use traditional rigid and expensive grippers to automate mundane, low-value tasks. Soft grippers can provide a solution, adapting to variations in objects and other conditions. Enabling electrical operation of soft fingers enables direct integration with robotic arms eliminating complex infrastructure requirements and reducing cost, which will help improve the return on investment and reduce barriers of entry for small businesses to utilize this latest technology. The research will undertake testing and validation under common, realistic conditions encountered in fresh produce picking and packing and e-commerce order fulfillment applications. The research goals are to: optimize the design and fabrication techniques and quantify grasping behavior for improved adaptability, provide feedback control, and integrate intelligence to the grippers by incorporating data and user input to determine optimal grasp parameters.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The food and beverage (F&B) industry is unique compared to other industries regarding automation. Food products' shape, size, weight, and texture are rarely consistent. During SBIR Phase I, UBIROS Inc. has commercialized a unique, safe, delicate, and adaptable soft robotic gripper named Gentle, allowing robots to pick up universal objects based on our innovative patented soft robot technology. The gripper Gentle is developed as electrically actuated soft fingers which can grasp anything within a broad range of object sizes and shapes and tolerate significant positioning errors. Since the soft fingers conform to the shape of the potentially fragile object, it does not cause any damage or bruising on the object's surface. It is a user-friendly, adaptable, controllable, expandable, and cost-efficient product (see Figure 1). Gentle is directly compatible with existing robot hardware, easy to control the force and speed of grasping, and adaptable to computer vision or force sensors with ease of installation.  

The F&B packaging sector requires multiple kinds of automated solutions for various products, such as meal kits, free-range food, meat, and perishable foods, due to the short life cycles of food items. To broaden the versatility of the Gentle series of grippers, our product has been developed with a highly scalable, modular design and manufacturing process where each independent soft finger module can be arranged in different configurations.

Deploying soft robotic automation solutions in the F&B industry is essential to increase productivity up to nine times for a sustainable, hygienic production environment. UBIROS optimized Gentle grippers and identified the convenient grasping parameters such as load, flexion, and weight during SBIR Phase I regarding industry needs. Moreover, safe zone and error tolerance descriptions have been generated by considering these parameters to successfully grasp multiple delicate and rigid food objects without causing any harm. Intelligence feature has also been introduced to the gripper Gentle via sensorization to expand its capabilities for a human-computer environment. The generated data is suitable for combining with machine learning approaches to enable a reliable grip and real-time inspection to detect defects.

Due to the rising requirement for the handling of hygienic food products in the market and the increased labor shortage caused by the COVID-19 pandemic conditions, automated processes have become more significant since the introduction of Gentle to the market. UBIROS launched Gentle, which provides hygienic handling and easy cleaning of food products with a simple, food-grade silicone finger design that does not contain seams or lubricants. All these features have been carried out in the commercialization step, considering the costs that small businesses can reach.

In addition, UBIROS offers the Gentle gripper, a versatile and cost-effective soft robotics tool for research institutes and universities to boost utilization in new domains such as food, biology, agriculture, medicine, and ocean exploration, as well as food picking/packing and warehouse operations.

Briefly, UBIROS has offered its Gentle gripper to reduce labor issues, automate production processes and achieve maximum throughputs for food producers and warehouse order fulfillment operations, leading to a stronger economy and improved quality of life.

 

 

 


Last Modified: 05/13/2022
Modified by: Tugba Efendigil

Image
  • UBIROS's Gentle picking up a wide range of objects of different sizes, shapes, and weights (muffin, cranberry, rose, toy, cardboard box, croissant)
